title: HB Wallet
author: HB Wallet
content: The keyword ‘Bitcoin Rejoin’ has risen recently as a new way to trade crypto passively.When searching on the Internet, you may come across its different versions.One may claim its advantage of using AI Algorithm to trade BTC, which can grow from 250 USD to 1 million USD in a short amount of time.Others may introduce its automated trading system that will join CFD system in the future.They would look different in domain name (URL), logo, and site appearance, but they all ask for the same exact initial deposit of 250 USD. Why is that? Why Bitcoin Rejoin is a Scam?Read our article: What is Bitcoin Rejoin? 3 Cold Hard Facts

comments.author: avikz
comments.body: From my past experience I can say whatever platform claims to use AI and bot trading to generate income for the investors - are ponzi scams! The two domains mentioned in the article looks very very Similar.Nothing can beat human brain. Trading bots can make couple of profitable trades based on certain market conditions but there's no guarantee that it will work under every situation. So it is always better to stay out of such shady websites and platforms claiming unrealistic outcomes.

comments.author: hZti
comments.body: Quote from: HB Wallet on June 24, 2022, 07:02:11 AMOne may claim its advantage of using AI Algorithm to trade BTC, which can grow from 250 USD to 1 million USD in a short amount of time.This is impossible to archive and guaranteed a scam. I hope you never deposit anything to such a site. If they can give me one sample where a crypto trading bot made 250 USD to 1 Million dollar and I will take everything back but I am 100 % you they can't  give that example. Also I don't see the point in this giant picture that you posted

comments.author: Iadegbola34
comments.body: One common thing about financial scams is very high unrealistic promise to exploit the natural human greed on their victims. A bot can certainly make profit from trading some particular asset but overtime they always end up as just another scam. $250 to $1M is very unrealistic to even consider investing with such investment platform.

comments.author: coolcoinz
comments.body: A platform that claims to be able to do something for you and make you money is always a scam of some kind. We had so much of this. Like there were cloud mining platforms, bitcoin multipliers, sites that were hacking blockchain and giving you some of the coins from every transaction sent by other people... Nowadays there are youtube giveaways where Vitalik or Elon are giving you free coins, you just have to send them some of your coins and you'll get more back. Let's not forget about those sites that mine for you or generate passive income, but you have to buy upgrades for the site to do it faster. If it was possible to keep trading with consistent success, all those traders would be sitting on their asses and trading 24/7 instead of trying to sell you their tips, portfolios and self-improvement courses.

comments.author: arwin100
comments.body: Quote from: HB Wallet on June 24, 2022, 07:02:11 AMThe keyword ‘Bitcoin Rejoin’ has risen recently as a new way to trade crypto passively.When searching on the Internet, you may come across its different versions.One may claim its advantage of using AI Algorithm to trade BTC, which can grow from 250 USD to 1 million USD in a short amount of time.Others may introduce its automated trading system that will join CFD system in the future.They would look different in domain name (URL), logo, and site appearance, but they all ask for the same exact initial deposit of 250 USD. Why is that? Why Bitcoin Rejoin is a Scam?Read our article: What is Bitcoin Rejoin? 3 Cold Hard FactsPeople need to understand that trading bots is there to automate your trading task and its not created to give you guaranteed profit and if someone offer a passive profit especially a huge amount offer in return of your investment is a pure scam. This is common methods use by scammer and that Bitcoin Rejoin is another classic scamming scheme which is again used by fraud ms to scam newbie investors.

comments.author: vennali
comments.body: Quote from: HB Wallet on June 24, 2022, 07:02:11 AMThe keyword ‘Bitcoin Rejoin’ has risen recently as a new way to trade crypto passively.One may claim its advantage of using AI Algorithm to trade BTC, which can grow from 250 USD to 1 million USD in a short amount of time.You have already spoken the golden words that gives us a huuuuge hint that it is a scam. unrealistic profits are what these scams use to lure people in. You have to be mentally challenged at this point to fall for this especially after what recently happened to luna. I don't even need to look at any other reasons to solidify my opinion on it.

comments.author: KennyR
comments.body: Nowadays wherever we turn it is possible to see something relative to cryptocurrency. When someone requests to deposit $250 and makes you believe that the same $250 can be turned to be a million is a kind of trigger. You people will think, just $250 why don't give a try. Just think of 100 people falling for this scam. It turns to be $25k in the scammers pocket. So, it is way for the scammer to turn millionaire and don't get into such schemes.

comments.author: xSkylarx
comments.body: I visited their website https://bitcoinrejoin.io/ saw this. The statements on FAQ obviously shows it is a scam. They don't even explain how their platform works. You just need to create an account, make a deposit of 250$ then you'll become a millionaire. They even ask you to invest more than that to make it more quicker which is a big red flag. They also use the name of Elon Musk and Richard Branson to attract more to invest on their platform.

comments.author: Dunamisx
comments.body: I believe to an extent I don't need the help of someone or bot in trading for me because all these are centralized organizations that build up their site when i know how to trade personally, some investment of cryptocurrency on other platforms in the name of yielding profit isn't what is supposed to be, most turn out to be a scam site with a promise of certain return rate ROI to their users, the needed advice here is to learn how to be independent when dealing with bitcoin in other to remain decentralized and secure the required privacy needed for maximum protection.

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: You should probably change the title of this post because it sounds too similar to "Bitcoin is a scam" (which is clearly false) or some Bitcoin protocol feature is a scam. But instead it's talking about a completely different web service hosted on fraud websites.

comments.author: kaseygriffin
comments.body: I'm not too smart to analyze everything complicated they say, but think more simply about those people making excuses by sharing their skills to make everyone rich together . And that's bullshit in the current world when greed and selfishness make many people willing to take advantage of people's information restrictions to make money. I do not equate all tools when the main problem is the user, and they have the right to choose them. It's not very sympathetic when someone invites about the profit they make from using a certain service. I always think it's better for them to make their own money with what they think will bring success and not take advantage of people's trust.

comments.author: hZti
comments.body: Quote from: kaseygriffin on June 25, 2022, 06:15:09 AMI'm not too smart to analyze everything complicated they say, but think more simply about those people making excuses by sharing their skills to make everyone rich together . You don't need to be able to answer every of their claims to see that this is a scam. If it would be possible to turn 250 USD in the matter of days in a million USD you know it is a scam. Where should all this money come from? If somebody earns it by trading, some other person has to loose it. And I don't see any possibility that people loose that amount to a trading bot in such a short time.

comments.author: ImThour
comments.body: If any service offers you to be able to make you money, I am sure that is purely a scam. If they could make money from it, they would never make it public.They would keep that service/bot only for them to make millions and not sell it to others. I think this is what you should think about in these situations.

comments.author: so98nn
comments.body: Definitely scam, does not even have second thought for this one. There were also sites which were made to do online tasks, mining shares, clicking and advertising sites with the same thought as this one. The only difference was they used to ask same amount of money for their premium features. They used to lure peeps into their nice looking sites, perfectly working payment systems and what not but at the end you had to get the premium features so that you can benefit more and more. But obviously that was scam and Bitcoin Rejoin also same thing.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: This is the first time I hear about Bitcoin Rejoins. Anyone who believes that all they need to do to become a Bitcoin millionaire is to sign up to some Rejoin service and let its bot and AI do all the work, while they are sipping margaritas with two Playboy models at the beach deserves to be scammed. Not to mention the ridiculous returns that seemed to be promised. It would be even more sad if you could manually adjust your profit percentage by sliding your finger from 400.000% a year to let's say a nice and round 700.000%.

comments.author: teosanru
comments.body: Quote from: HB Wallet on June 24, 2022, 07:02:11 AMThe keyword ‘Bitcoin Rejoin’ has risen recently as a new way to trade crypto passively.When searching on the Internet, you may come across its different versions.One may claim its advantage of using AI Algorithm to trade BTC, which can grow from 250 USD to 1 million USD in a short amount of time.Others may introduce its automated trading system that will join CFD system in the future.They would look different in domain name (URL), logo, and site appearance, but they all ask for the same exact initial deposit of 250 USD. Why is that? Why Bitcoin Rejoin is a Scam?Read our article: What is Bitcoin Rejoin? 3 Cold Hard FactsIf a platform is selling you(an average retail investor) a bot which can multiply your money then it is certain that this is nothing but a scam. Because by simple logic if the company would be making so much money with the bot itself why will it need to sell the bot to make money? Or maybe it will go to a bigger institution to sell them the same bot and get big price for that. So it's a clear rule for life that such a thing will always be a scam.

comments.author: DapanasFruit
comments.body: Judging on what I am seeing right now, this is just another scam or Ponzi project that is using the popular name of Bitcoin so it can be victimizing as many people as possible out of their $250 capital promised to be creating millions - yes  millions of digital bubble until the program will collapse. Nothing new here, the same scam strategy and technique though it is not adding AI to the mix so it can fool more. As one of the many victims of Ponzi schemes, I can easily smell something fishy in this program. We should run away to the mountains and hide in there if Bitcoin Rejoin comes near to us. We must always be careful.

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: Quote from: coolcoinz on June 24, 2022, 09:29:09 PM We had so much of this. Like there were cloud mining platforms, bitcoin multipliers, sites that were hacking blockchain and giving you some of the coins from every transaction sent by other people... Nowadays there are YouTube giveaways where Vitalik or Elon are giving you free coins, you just have to send them some of your coins and you'll get more back. Three categories of persons still fall victim to these sort of scams;- the naïve persons who happen to just be very enthusiastic about crypto and how they can profit from it.These set of persons already have a developed interest in bitcoin maybe due to positive testimonials they have heard about crypto, as a result, if they lack proper guidance they make themselves vulnerable. Some of this persons go as afar as sending a message to the so called customer care asking how they can join and hoping to know it is legit. The scammers knowing that this person is naïve will capitalize on that and just have to convince them enough for them to get started.- the set of person who underestimate how far scammers can go to achieve their aim.Some people never believe that scammers are very intelligent people that are devising new means daily, when they see some sophistication, they assume that ''scammers can't do this", they can't come this far, and that mindset usually always cost them a lot. As a matter of fact some individuals are currently invested in some such ponzi website without them knowing because they have the ideology that scammers do not have the organization to put such together.- the greedy.These category do not think well when they see or hear the promise of money/profit. They do not consider the ridiculous gains promised by these scammers, they are all about their personal interest/profit and that blocks rational thinking.

comments.author: seoincorporation
comments.body: Anything that offers $250 to $1M is a scam without any doubt.Is sad to see how people keep falling into this type of ponzis, and it's sad to see how people don't understand that if it's too good to be real then is a scam. The reality is they will keep scamming and there is nothing that we can do to prevent it. If we work hard to close their scam, then they will open 10 more, that's how it works.
